answers.answer: There are several types of infection and several routes of spreading it. A diabetic ulcer generally is not contagious unless  there is more than your friend is telling you. If the ulcer has some nasty bugs called MRSA or VRE - I am not a doctor but a diabetic for the last 7 years - then the concern becomes where the organism is - in the infection site only or is it in the blood.

question: A FRIEND OF MINE AND I ARE SEXUALLY ACTIVE AND HE JUST RECENTLY FOUND OUT THAT HE HAS A VERY BAD INFECTION IN HIS FOOT RELATED TO HIS DIABETES.  IS IT POSSIBLE TO PASS THE INFECTION OUT TO ME? HE TOLD ME THAT HE WAS TOLD THAT ONCE AN INFECTION WAS IN YOUR SYSTEM, IT COULD BE PASSED AND NOW HE IS WORRIED THAT I MAY GET SICK.
title: SEMEN
